result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Lee Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court orders restitution set at $0. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court orders all costs and surcharges to be paid during the period of probation.  If revoked, DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Any unpaid portion to convert to a civil judgment.

*No weapons; 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

*No contact with victim, Isaac W.;
*No new offenses;

timeConds.notes: *Court imposed and stayed 90 days in the House of Correction for use by probation department.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Lee Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Removed reference language from Count 2

Filed: Order Correcting Judgment of Conviction.

THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is amended to remove the reference to "939.63(1)(b) Use of a Dangerous Weapon" from count two.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify penalty enhancer on count two.
Reflects 18 months Probation on Count 1 (omitted on original JOC)

- dated 1/12/16, filed by the State. 
COURT ORDERS LETTER FILED UNDER SEAL.

Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter continues on the record.  Court reviews letter submission filed by the State, Court orders letter FILED UNDER SEAL.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements made as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS (CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2), with credit for 108 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program". 
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections (CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1).
The Court STAYED both sentences and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 MONTHS.
Court orders the following conditions of probation and extended supervision:
*No contact with victim, Isaac W.;
*No weapons;
*No new offenses;
*Absolute sobriety.
*Court imposed and stayed 90 days in the House of Correction for use by probation department.
Court orders restitution set at $0. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court orders all costs and surcharges to be paid during the period of probation.  If revoked, DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Any unpaid portion to convert to a civil judgment.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
**COURT ORDERS TRANSCRIPT OF SENTENCING HEARING SEALED.**

Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing today.  Due to recently received information, both parties are requesting an adjourned date.  Court grants requests and orders hearing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.
Justice Point Violation Report, filed.  Court takes no action, matter remains scheduled for sentencing hearing on 1/20/16 at 8:30am in br. 35.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing today.  Parties jointly request adjournment.  Court grants request and orders sentencing hearing adjourned.  NO FURTHER ADJOURNMENTS will be granted.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Denis John Stingl for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing. Defense requests adjournment, State does not object.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties stipulate to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-18-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant is turned over to Justice Point for monitoring.  Court orders no possession of firearms. NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS.

Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information recieved and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilt as to both counts.Amended Information received and filed. 

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armour. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Awni M Yasin in court, defendant Steven Lee Taylor not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant withdraws speedy trial demand.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in custody.  Denis Stingl for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 7.    Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
  Jury trial scheduled for 05-06-2015 at 09:30 am.

  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 3.19.15 and for jury trial on 4.15.15.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 03-19-2015 at 08:30 am.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in custody.  Michael Kessler, student intern under the supervision of Ron Dague for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TARIK H., JAQUAN J., ISAAC W. AND PASTORA J.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Steven Lee Taylor in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
